attributes.action: Place an age restriction for the sale and usage of disposable barbecues
attributes.background: To put an age restriction on the sale and usage of disposable barbecues to protect our fire service, residents and the natural habitat.
attributes.additional_details: Moorland and forest fires have increased recently due to improper usage of disposable barbecues used by youths. This has caused extra pressure on our fire service and their resources and hundreds of acres of natural habitats have subsequently been damaged.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328763

attributes.action: Protect sensitive habitats from sources of fire including disposable BBQ's
attributes.background: Our natural habitats are being burnt to destruction by fires caused by carelessness and negligence from disposable BBQ's and other sources.    The government needs to introduce special protection for our at risk areas and specific controls for the use of disposable BBQ's.
attributes.additional_details: An increase in natural wildfires combined with fires caused by human carelessness suggests we need to do more to protect our countryside from fire.  In May 2020 significant wildfires in the UK demonstrated the habitat damage that can be caused and the risk to life. With some potentially caused by disposable BBQ's we need further measures to protect our environment. Control of disposable BBQ's as well as introduction of designations and controls for at risk areas would be a start.

rejection.details:
We understand that you're concerned about fire in sensitive habitats, but we're not sure what specific action you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to take. 

You could start a new petition asking the UK Parliament or Government to fund fire control measures in sensitive habitats. 

You might like to sign and share this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Ban the sale and use of single use barbecues, for the sake of UK nature.
attributes.background:
The Wareham Forest blaze of May 202 is believed to be one of the most devastating forest and heath fires in Dorset in living memory.
The loss to wildlife was immense, and has pushed some species to the brink of extinction.
Single use barbecues must be banned immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
Dorset & Wiltshire Fire and Rescue Service, whose crews from all 50 fire stations from across the service attended the incident at some point over the last week, said 220 hectares – the size of over 230 football pitches – of forest and heathland has been destroyed.
It started on Monday, May 18 through 'social activity' – discarded barbecues, campfires and glass bottles were found at the site.
This incident highlights how devastating and resource intensive heath and forest fires are.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Ban use of non-pregnant models to sell maternity clothing
attributes.background: During COVID, pregnant women are being forced to look online for representations of themselves. Pregnancy is a time of natural bodily change and the perception of what is normal is being negatively affected by the use of standard "fake bumps" on models who are not pregnant, impacting mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no such thing as a "standard" bump and this is creating unrealistic beauty expectations, whilst retailers benefit from increased sales online from expectant mothers who are isolating. Pregnant models are also losing career opportunities in what should constitute maternity discrimination.

 As a part of society that can no longer interact with other expectant mothers and is subsequently less visible, this adds to the mental health pressures of women during COVID and should be addressed.

rejection.details:

departments.name: Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport

attributes.action: Give all commonwealth veterans indefinite leave to remain in the UK
attributes.background: At present Armed Forces Commonwealth Veterans have to apply and pay for British Citizenship when leaving service, I believe that after a qualifying period that ALL Commonwealth Service personnel and their immediate families should receive automatic citizenship without the need to apply.
attributes.additional_details: It should be a natural, given right that service personnel from the commonwealth are given the freedoms of the country that they have served. Our government actively recruited them and many have served with distinction. Yet they are treated as illegal immigrants when it comes to nhs care and other support. It is only right and decent that the government uphold the Armed Forces Covenant and grant commonwealth Veterans indefinite leave to remain at the very least once they have been discharged

attributes.action: GOV.UK must acknowledge why self-employed agency workers are being denied SEISS!
attributes.background:
Due to stricter IR35 policy that came into play in recent years, staffing agencies across the country deduct tax at source for work carried out by freelancers who would otherwise use their UTR and invoice them. 

Many self-employed, therefore, have a mixture of PAYE and Invoiced income.
attributes.additional_details:
However, due to the nature of the work, many freelancers have PAYE income on their returns for agencies they've not engaged with since the 18-19 tax year, so they can't be furloughed and if it outweighs their invoiced work, they don't qualify for SEISS either. 

When the chancellor talks about the 5% who 'fall through the crack', he refers to people with NO income history. 

Currently, thousands of self-employed workers that CAN provide their income history are being denied much-needed support.

attributes.background: End the lockdown with immediate effect and encourage return to normal life for those who are not vulnerable.
attributes.additional_details: The lockdown is a flawed policy which is not only unproven but takes no account of the immeasurable harm to society from the lockdown itself, direct and indirect consequent death, economic ruin,  societal breakdown, with catastrophic damage to interpersonal behaviour which might be permanent. It assumes that a vaccine will become available, which all scientists accept is by no means certain. It prevents the natural defence of herd immunity, and encourages aggressive strains of the virus.

attributes.action: Open Tattoo Parlours earlier in the UK Governments Covid 19 recovery strategy.
attributes.background: Having reviewed the Government's strategy, we would like to open a discussion around our industry's placement within the strategy. We believe that, with the correct protocols in place to ensure the safety of tattooist and our clients, we should be allowed to open at a much earlier stage.
attributes.additional_details: Our studios have more experience than most other businesses when it comes to cross contamination, disease control and disinfection. Our work, by its very nature, demands its participants to be cognisant always of the necessity of following rigorous standards of hygiene.  We have self-regulated for many years. We would suggest that, with our already heightened understanding of health and hygiene in our workplace, we are better equipped than most to deal with the ever-looming threat of infection.

attributes.action: Refuse to financially assist businesses registered abroad to avoid paying UK tax
attributes.background: We want the UK government to categorically promise that no firm that has registered offshore for the purpose of avoiding or lowering its tax responsibility will benefit from any government assistance for losses incurred due to the Covid-19 epidemic when this assistance is funded by the UK taxpayer.
attributes.additional_details: We feel that is morally irresponsible to assist businesses that have purposely avoided paying their fair share in UK tax. If the UK financially assists companies registered abroad for tax avoidance purposes, then these companies must be forced to pay their tax in the UK and this should be backdated to the time of registration. It would be highly unfair to put a financial burden of this nature on the UK taxpayer.

attributes.action: End Coronavirus lock down for under 50s households and a staged end for others.
attributes.background: End the lockdown for those at low risk which includes most under 50s households or households with young children and single adults. Then as NHS capacity allows, have a staged return for other groups. The elderly and most vulnerable will be protected till the virus naturally dies out.
attributes.additional_details:
We in the UK have a long held right to freedom unless duly convicted by our peers. Instead, we have all been held under house arrest with no trial and not even allowed to examine the models that supposedly require the lost of our human rights.

The death rate for under 50s appears to be very small or 0.2% of those tested and likely close to 0.01% of the total population which is similar to flu. NHS hospitals whilst busy have the capacity to deal with those under 50 returning to normal life.

attributes.background: We appeal to the government to bring the British Insurers to heel for their unresponsiveness and disregard for government directive on business interruption insurance. attributes.additional_details: Businesses have insured themselves against risk paying hefty premiums and many are now left with no option but to lay off people and go bust. Insurers are refusing to engage despite the PM stating that he added covid 19 to the infectious disease list so that companies could claim. attributes.action: Rent and bills frozen period while Coronavirus pandemic.
attributes.background:
Dear All,

Here to inspire the government to possibly support citizens in this period of uncertainties.

Here to ask after seeing measures being taken by El Salvador and Colombia recently, to freeze home rents and bills related for a period of 3 months and more.
attributes.additional_details:
Being countries where wealth isn’t at the top of the list, they managed something like that; the United Kingdom being part of one of the wealth countries in the world’s list, could introduce measures similar to the ones written above; or even, also improve them.

While an increase of Universal Credit demands reached almost a million, will be of sense of adjustments written in this request, to balance this economic nature we are facing in this era.

Just to add, this month will be important for some religious festivities (chronologically Passover, Easter and Ramadan), will be of help for people to bring something to rejoice in this period of unprecedented events, as well.

Hope everyone is doing good in the meanwhile.

Thank you.

attributes.background: Garden Centres are allowed to sell food & pet care, but not plants? 66 million UK citizens are in lockdown, if we can spend less time on phones & tablets and more in our gardens with nature, growing fruit, veg & flowers its a proven therapy for mental health & wellbeing so reduces strain on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
It is through plants that children gain essential learning whilst at home. Nature soothes us, we need this during a lockdown that isolates us from our family and friends.
 
Half a billion pre grown plants for this spring valued at £250 million will perish. Without garden centres to take them they will be dumped on huge compost pile. These independent growers employ 45,000 people, an entire sector will be decimated, leaving us reliant on imported plants from Europe.

attributes.additional_details: There is much evidence that gardening is extremely beneficial for good mental health even for people with no outside space. attributes.action: Extend Self-employment Income Support Scheme eligibility to cover new businesses
attributes.background: Find a way to extend the Self-employment Income Support Scheme to cover business started in the last year. A potential solution could be to offer a loan that is repayable next year. If the claimant has filed a tax return in the meantime for self employment and is eligible, the loan is void.
attributes.additional_details: The support available for new businesses in these times isn't enough, especially when a household isn't entitled to other benefits (i.e. Universal Credit). Many households that fit into this category will be struggling severely. Loans are available but the nature of many new businesses means that revenue and profit can be expected to be low and repaying loans isn't feasible. It's fantastic that the government is covering the 80% wage for older businesses but newer businesses need more help.

attributes.background: Close down all non essential construction sites. Essential sites should be contributing to treating or prevention of coronavirus or aiding key workers and not simply because buildings need to be completed by certain timescales.
attributes.additional_details:

Unless the work is on a hospital or to ensure vital water/electricity is being supplied to homes/hospitals/schools, there is no reason for these sites to remain open.

attributes.action: Award all NHS Staff and support workers a Covid-19 campaign medal
attributes.background: In recognition of the enormous personal effort and sacrifice made by all NHS and support staff during the Covid-19 pandemic the UK Government awards them with a campaign medal and ribbon. The medal would be similar to the type issued to military personnel during operational tours of duty.
attributes.additional_details: Only the Queen and UK Government can create such an award. The award would take the nature of a medal and ribbon. The medal to be worn during remembrance and civic events and the ribbon to worn on the daily working uniform of NHS staff and support workers. It is clear the NHS staff are fighting the greatest threat to the UK in its peacetime history. It would help to ensure that the national appreciation of NHS workers during this pandemic becomes an enduring one for generations to come.

Breastfeeding mums should be tested. The reason behing it is science. Immunity/antibodies is passed from mum to baby when the mums immune system is triggerd. attributes.action: A trade alignment with the EU or with the US? The people should decide.
attributes.background:
Question:
A trade deal with the United States or a trade deal with the European Union?

 Proposition: 
The final decision as to which choice the country makes should be put to the people in a public vote before the end of the Transition Period.
attributes.additional_details: Having now left the EU the trading relationship we form with our closest geographical neighbours should not be decided solely by our government in Westminster, without having first consulted with the people of the UK. Should Britain align itself primarily with the EU or with the US is a decision of profound, and long-term, importance that needs to be put to the people, in a public vote, once the nature and outcomes of current trade talks and their potential outcomes become better understood.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Trade deals with different entities are not mutually exclusive, so it's not clear why there would need to be a referendum on choosing between them. 

You might like to sign these petitions 
	
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301051
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300026

attributes.action: Release daily, detailed information on Coronavirus cases as other countries do
attributes.background: The plan to stop regular announcements of new cases and release them weekly is dangerous. Given the fast moving nature of the virus, people need regular information to make the best choices and prevent panic. We suggest a daily-updated dashboard such as that used by Singapore: https://co.vid19.sg/
attributes.additional_details:
When people don't have access to information, they panic. If they have the data they need, they can look at the risks and make better choices for themselves and families. 

As has been seen throughout the world, a huge amount can happen in a week. Coronavirus cases can jump from a handful to hundreds in that time. 

By deciding to only release information weekly, the Government will be undermining the public's ability to slow the spread of the virus.

rejection.details:
Since this petition was created, the Chief Medical Officer has confirmed that daily updates will continue.

You can read his remarks during an appearance before the Health Select Committee at https://committees.parliament.uk/work/81/preparations-for-coronavirus/publications/

attributes.action: Ban Recreational Fishing
attributes.background: Fishing is not a gentle hobby. We believe it is animal cruelty. Fishing for leisure is as bad as hunting. It is hunting, albeit aquatic hunting. Even if the person fishing puts them back, they may still have hurt the fish or caused it distress. Many fish die after being caught.
attributes.additional_details: Millions of fish are caught by anglers and others who fish as a hobby. In 2022, there are many ways for people to get out and relax and enjoy themselves in nature, including by the sea, without hooking innocent animals, tearing their lips, causing them distress, causing their swim bladders to expand and then either throwing the poor creatures back or killing them.

attributes.action: Require schools across England to start the school day at 10am.
attributes.background: Children across the country have missed out on vital bits of education this year. Due to this I believe the UK Government should do anything possible in order to increase the knowledge of students across the country.
attributes.additional_details: To increase students’ productivity I would like the Government move the start of the school day to 10am. Teenagers and adolescents going through puberty go through changes in their circadian rhythm which means they naturally fall asleep later and wake up later, making it difficult to be alert early in the mornings. Currently they are fighting their own biology to get to school on time. An early start can cause chronic sleep deprivation which in turn can affect there learning ability and adult health.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of disposable barbeques
attributes.background: The government should ban the sale and use of disposable barbeques. They are a huge risk to nature and the environment, and are very rarely used responsibly. The local councils do not provide adequate disposal areas for these barbeques. This creates a huge risk to the surroundings when left.
attributes.additional_details: There have recently been some disastrous effects from the poor disposal of these barbeques (see the recent Wareham Forest fire, fires in the New Forest, etc.). This has caused irreparable damage to the environment and nature. There have also been a huge amount of emergency service resources used needlessly due to the irresponsible users of these barbeques. These resources would be better spent on those who actually need it.

attributes.action: Use COVID-19 contact tracing from Apple / Google instead of a centralised system
attributes.background: The government and NHS is proposing a custom COVID-19 phone-based contact tracing application which uses a centralised model to track and trace contacts. This should be scrapped and replaced with the decentralised contact tracing protocol developed by Apple and Google, designed to respect privacy.
attributes.additional_details:
Apple and Google have developed a contact-tracing protocol which carefully respects users' privacy and is reviewed and vetted by technologists worldwide.
The UK government wants to use a custom system developed in conjunction with GCHQ to track people.
The UK's centralised system by it's nature is worse for users' privacy, and is more prone to hacking.
The UK's centralised system is worse for the battery life on phones.
The UK's custom system should be scrapped and the better system used.

attributes.action: Rename Green Park to Queen Elizabeth Park in our late Monarch’s honour
attributes.background: I would like the Govt to seek the endorsements necessary and rename Green Park as Queen Elizabeth Park as a memorial to our late Queen,  which is at the heart of London. I would like this formally done on the anniversary of her death in 2023.
attributes.additional_details: Green Park is already a Royal park with a link to the monarchy. There is no clear or historical reason why it is named Green Park. During the period of national mourning it became the place closest to Buckingham Palace where her public could lay flowers, leave messages and reflect on her life. It was also central to her funeral. The late Queen herself loved to be in nature. I myself was moved by the carpet of floral tributes laid there.

attributes.action: Urgently review and reverse, proposed DEFENCE CUTS/ ‘ONE ARMY’ CONCEPT
attributes.background:
Immediately and Urgently: 

1. Reverse dangerously (  ill considered)  Planned Defence Cuts

2. Recognise the significant inadequacies of the ‘One Army’ concept.

3:  Increase Military Forces Levels      (Strengths  and Equipment), to reflect all realistic current threats
attributes.additional_details:
Regular Forces have been depleted over many Governments,  in part due to the supposed !Peace Dividend’ of the late 20th Century.

The Ukraine conflict, and Russia, et al’s resurgent aggression, military ambition, and asymmetric attack policy/ strategy, require UK to ensure that  OUR ‘military response capability’ is adequate to ANY (reasonably) predictable events including Armed Hostility, and Natural Disasters.  

The world is now more dangerous, than it has been for many decades!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure if you'd like the defence cuts to be reviewed, or if you'd like them to be reversed - in which case it's not clear what the review would entail.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Look at subsistence cost for Mps.
attributes.background:

We should examine Mps food expenses to bring it In line with expectation for  the rest of the country.
attributes.additional_details:
While I appreciate  the ad-hoc nature of parliment means that there may be the occasional unexpected event.   We should still take into account the cost of living.

A canteen ioffering nutritious  meals at the the 30p level should suffice, and with bulk buying we could reduce costs further.  Giving both a good example, and reducing costs.

We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: http://www.theipsa.org.uk

attributes.additional_details:
To prevent dangerous or suspicious activity
To prevent accidents and misuse of property
To prevent Suicides

attributes.action: Fund corrosive testing kits for police forces to help tackle acid attacks
attributes.background: Police, and other emergency services, should receive funding for corrosive substance testing kits to help strengthen street searches and tackle acid attacks.
attributes.additional_details:
This could help decrease the incidence of crime and increase the response rate when identifying the nature of attack.
 
Acid attacks are one of the most torturous and brutal forms of attack, carried out using one of the cheapest, most accessible weapons. Corrosive substances are easy to conceal/mask and can go under the radar in police searches.
 
The aim of this torture method is to maim or kill, and the consequences survivors deal with are severely debilitating. This can include blindness, respiratory issues, burns, scars, societal judgement, occupational loss, psychological problems and more.

attributes.action: Amend guidance for DWP assessors to truly reflect the impact of migraines
attributes.background: Published guidance advises assessors that during an attack no specific impairment of function would be expected and there should not be any change in awareness or intellect. It is not accurate at all and needs to be revised for assessors or panellists without personal experience to justly review.
attributes.additional_details:
Migraine symptoms can be varying in nature and severity, many experience loss of speech, confusion, inability to focus thoughts or process what is going on around them. Additionally some experience stroke like symptoms, loss of balance and extreme fatigue, making movement and consciousness difficult. Furthermore the pain in the head and neck can be agonising. 
All of this goes against the guidance as they can considerably affect functionality both physically and mentally.

attributes.action: Seek to agree a 2-month global lockdown to reduce Covid transmission
attributes.background: We call on the Government to work internationally to secure a simultaneous global lockdown to reduce covid transmission. We would ask the Government to continue the furlough period for this two months and extend it to all employed people. Lockdowns could vary in nature between nations.
attributes.additional_details:
The virus is a like a batten in a relay race, once not moving transmission of the virus is reduced. A coordinated Global lockdown should help contain the virus, giving certainty back to people and business.
 
Summer is also often a less stressful time for many people and services. The 2-month period is informed by the maximum recorded incubation time, 27 days in Hubei + the 14-day post-infection period, plus time to check the spread of the virus has been reduced.

attributes.action: Temporarily ban the sale and use of disposable barbecues during lockdown
attributes.background: Countless warnings from fire services not to use disposable barbecues (and campfires) due to the risk of forest fires are being ignored. A local forest (Wareham, Dorset) has lost 220 hectares in a recent fire, taking over 150 firefighters to battle and there is an ongoing extreme fire risk.
attributes.additional_details:
As people begin to socialise with others outside but not at home, the use of these BBQs is likely to soar, posing an even greater risk to life and the environment and increasing strain on emergency services. 
Disposable barbecues are a well known danger, scorching the ground below during most uses and remaining hot for some time. Decimation of green areas by fire further accelerates climate change. This is in addition to their environmentally unfriendly single-use nature.
